failedVideos.title: Videos Failing? Read This
failedVideos.copyrightedDesc: Sora 2 has strict guardrails against third-party IP. Prompts referencing famous characters (e.g. Batman, Elsa) or franchises are typically rejected with a 'third-party content' violation. Even mentioning brand names, logos, or trademarks can trigger an automatic block.
failedVideos.realPeopleDesc: To prevent deepfakes, Sora 2 forbids using real individuals' likeness without consent. Prompts naming celebrities, politicians, or public figures will be filtered out. Uploading images with faces for animation is blocked entirely.
failedVideos.violenceDesc: Explicit depictions of violence, extreme gore, or weapon use are disallowed. Prompts like 'person holding a gun' or 'bloody fight scene' violate usage policy. Users should tone down to 'PG-13' action levels.
failedVideos.nsfwDesc: OpenAI does not allow pornographic or highly explicit sexual content in Sora 2. Prompts containing nudity, sexual acts, or erotic detail will be blocked by the moderation system.
failedVideos.politicalDesc: Prompts with hate speech, extreme political propaganda, self-harm instructions, or ToS-violating content are filtered. Even mild political or religious references can trip guardrails.
failedVideos.falsePositivesDesc: Content filters can be overly broad, causing unexpected failures. Even public domain characters or innocuous phrases may be misinterpreted and flagged as violations.
failedVideos.complexPromptsDesc: Excessively long or confusing prompts may hit system limits. Keep prompts concise and well-structured, focusing on one scene or action per prompt.
failedVideos.unsupportedSyntaxDesc: Sora 2 expects natural language descriptions. Unusual formatting, special symbols, or code-like structures may cause parsing errors.
failedVideos.imageInputDesc: Only standard image formats (PNG, JPEG) are accepted. Images must be free of faces, famous artwork, or copyrighted logos, or generation will be blocked.
failedVideos.durationMismatchDesc: If the prompt implies a lengthy sequence but the video duration is very short, rendering may fail or truncate unexpectedly. Break long sequences into smaller segments.
failedVideos.plainTextDesc: Critical: Sora 2 requires pure plain text. Hidden formatting, special characters, or markup from LLMs can cause failures. Always strip formatting before submitting.
failedVideos.lengthLimitsDesc: OpenAI imposes hard limits on video length and resolution based on your plan. Exceeding these limits will cause generation to fail or be cut off.
failedVideos.complexScenesDesc: Extremely complex scenes with many moving characters or intricate interactions can overwhelm the model, causing generation to stall or fail.
failedVideos.unsupportedFeaturesDesc: Sora 2 cannot generate readable text in videos or accept audio input. Attempting unsupported features will not work or may trigger filters.
failedVideos.hardwareDesc: At peak times or for complex prompts, the backend may run out of GPU resources, leading to server errors or silent failures after long waits.
failedVideos.accessDesc: Sora 2 requires proper account permissions. Without the necessary subscription tier or invite code, generation attempts will fail.
failedVideos.quotaDesc: OpenAI enforces usage quotas on Sora 2. If you've hit your generation limit, further attempts will fail with a 'limit reached' message.
failedVideos.betaFeaturesDesc: Advanced features like Storyboard mode are Pro-only. Attempting to use unavailable features for your account level will cause failures.
failedVideos.moderationFlagsDesc: The moderation API may flag content that seems harmless, causing generation to be blocked with vague error messages about policy violations.
failedVideos.serverErrorsDesc: Network issues, server overload, or backend timeouts can cause generation to fail. During peak usage times, jobs are more likely to encounter errors.
failedVideos.apiChangesDesc: When OpenAI updates the API, older implementations may break temporarily until they're updated to match new requirements.
